intro: Alsodeiopsis chippii subsp. rubra, commonly known as the red-stemmed alsodeiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant red stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
